summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum documenting the initial response to a medical emergency involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It records that Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with CPR in progress.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell during a medical emergency at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Pam Row
persons.context: The individual to whom the memorandum is addressed, located in New York, NY.

events.title: Medical Emergency - Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found on the floor of his cell, unresponsive, with CPR in progress by a Correctional Lieutenant and a Physician Assistant.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the morning of August 10, 2019.
CPR was already in progress by a Correctional Lieutenant and a Physician Assistant when the responding officer arrived.
Epstein was transported to Health Services following the discovery.
The document is an official Bureau of Prisons memorandum created on the date of the incident.
